# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

using the following text: 
```julia-repl
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"
```

# Code

## Using a loop

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width=10)
    new_str = ""
    len = 0
    
    for word in split(s, " ")
        if (len + length(word)) > text_width
            new_str *= "\n" * word * " "
            len = length(word) + 1
        else
            new_str *= word * " "
            len += length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    
    return new_str
end
```

## Using regexp

This is a more compact way to do it:

```julia
using Printf # for the @printf macro

function wrap_string(s::String; text_width=10)
    new_str = ""
    len = 0
    
    for word in split(s, " ")
        if (len + length(word)) > text_width
            @printf "%s\n" word
        else
            @printf "%s " word
        end
    end
end
```
